name: Leg Press on Hackenschmidt Machine
how_to_perform:
1. Begin by adjusting the Hackenschmidt machine to your preference. Ensure the backrest is at a comfortable angle and the foot platform is positioned such that your feet will be shoulder-width apart when pressed against it.
2. Sit down on the seat with your back firmly against the backrest. Place your feet on the foot platform, about shoulder-width apart, with your toes pointing slightly outward.
3. Grip the side handles of the machine for stability. Make sure your entire body is securely positioned, with your head and back pressed firmly against the backrest.
4. Start with your legs bent at approximately a 90-degree angle, ensuring your knees are aligned over your ankles.
5. As you perform the exercise, keep your core engaged to provide stability and maintain proper form.
6. Begin the movement by pressing through your heels to extend your legs, pushing against the platform. Be careful not to lock your knees at the top of the movement.
7. Slowly lower the platform by bending your knees, returning to the starting 90-degree angle. Make sure to control the motion and keep tension in your legs throughout the exercise.
8. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining a steady pace and proper form throughout each repetition.
9. After completing your set, gently return the weights to their starting position, ensuring your safety.
10. Step out carefully from the machine after your exercise session.
short_summary: The Leg Press on a Hackenschmidt Machine is a leg strengthening exercise performed by pushing a weighted platform with your legs while seated.
